intro: Guarea glabra subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth guarea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy upper surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing fragrant, yellowish blooms that attract pollinators. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal.
